Thanks to everyone who attended the Cantera workshop on Sunday for 
making it a success.  We had a full house (30+) the entire day.  For 
those who couldn't make it, I'll try to collect together the 
presentations and  post them on the web site.  We agreed to do it again 
in 2 years in Heidelberg, so mark your calendars now.

Unfortunately it appears there is a  problem with the version of 
Cantera on the CDs passed out at the workshop, at least if you want to 
translate Chemkin-format mechanism files. A bug crept into the 
Chemkin-to-Cantera file conversion utility 'ck2cti' that I didn't catch 
before we made the CDs.  As a result, the translator reports 'syntax 
errors' in the Chemkin-format file even if it is correct.  (Everything 
should work fine, however, when using cti input files.)
The problem has been fixed and the CVS repository has been updated.

Also, I have now made a Mac OS X 10.3 binary installer for Cantera and 
will upload it to sourceforge.  If you have a Mac, you'll be able to 
install a complete version of Cantera, ready to use from Python, 
Matlab, or from your own C++ or Fortran programs, without compiling 
anything.

It was a pleasure to meet those of you who attended the workshop 
Sunday.  If you are here in Chicago this week but didn't make it to the 
workshop, catch me if you have Cantera comments, questions, etc.

Dave
